Posts.Content: Fantastic news so pleased for you. Dee xx
Posts.Title: The neoadjuvant chemo is working.

Posts.Content: Hi Nicky Please don't worry about your operation as mistymoley said you have done the hardest part,i too did chemo first and am sat in front of computer today after going into hospital on Tuesday at 11.30 for my mastectomy and I came home yesterday at 11am and believe me I was terrified if I could have ran I would have done,but I feel great really I do I feel as if a ton weight has been lifted off my shoulders because my breast containing my squatters had gone,appartently the first words I said on coming round in recovery were I DID IT(thank goodness I didn.t swear).I looked at the clock and it was 3.50 and as I came round the clock said 5.50 equivalent to a nanna nap,we can do this be strong.. thinking of you Love and hugs dee xxxxxxx
Posts.Title: Why ?
petition the government to continue Kadcyla for breast cancer patients...

Posts.Content: Hi GaryN1, You are in excellant hands,I was treated at The Pink Rose Grimsby under Mr.Butt and Jenny Smith who did my mastectomy,I had a picc line put in and as Lynn said its so much easier. Will be thinking of you on Tuesday. Dee xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx
Posts.Title: My left breast has been removed

Posts.Content: Hi Janette, Sending you hope and strength for today. Big cyber hugs from me Love Dee xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx
Posts.Title: I need help please.

Posts.Content: Hi Worried, That's great news am so happy for you............ Now breathe....... and do a celebratery jig around the kitchen but be careful not to spill ya drink. Love and Hugs Dee xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx
Posts.Title: I have my results

Posts.Content: Well done Lynn so happy for you ,wishing you all the luck in the world,enjoy your freedom after all the treatment.love and hugs Dee xxxxxxxx
Posts.Title: Finished at last!!!!

Posts.Content: My loving,beautiful and supportive family and friends,i wish you peace and joy. My virtual friends I wish you too peace and joy. All of you have got me through this last 8 months of treatment from the bottom of my heart thankyou. So a very merry Christmas and a happy new year,lets hope its a good one. xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx
Posts.Title: Two thanks and a Wish...

Posts.Content: Hi everyone thought everything was moving along quickly but I was  managing it all,saw oncologist on Monday got to know my treatment etc,knew I needed an mri for exact sizing and then onto having a marker put in. Had my mri this morning and have just had a call from my bcn telling me not to go next week as woman who does marker has looked at my mri and said she would struggle to find where to put it,cant tell me much more all to be discussed on Tuesday and they will ring me. Iasked if I was still having my chemo and yes that's all on track. Is my marker not being done because my cancer is to large they wouldn.t say...I am back where I was at diagnosis thinking all the bad things have any of you had this happens I am in a bad place again right now. grannie xxxxxxxx
Posts.Title: mri

Posts.Content: Hi Lynn,Carolyn,Steve and Helen Many thanks for your replies I am a little more calmer at the moment,have thrown myself into some good old fashioned housework in readiness for my chemo. Its just so worrying and as hard as you try to drive those bad thoughts out they seem to sneak up on you. My ct scan a couple of weeks ago showed I didn.t have it anywhere else,but mri is more in depth I know but best to find that now so treatment plan can be tweaked if necessary its just when bcn said they would struggle to find space for marker I panicked, As soon as your messages started coming in I didn.t feel alone again so if the sqatters in my right breast have invited others to stay or I have an obese squatter or they are taking up residence outside of my breast then they had better watch out because they have really peed me off now and the eviction notice is on its way. thanks all of you, denisexxxxxxxxxx
Posts.Title: mri

Posts.Content: Hi I got it on line from Bohemia headwear it was £10 there is another site called heathers hair were you pay just £2 for post and packaging and then make a donation thru the bank . I am having mastectomy after chemo to shrink my squatters so I will be going on another site called knitted knockers its another charity site for ladies like us. Hugs  Dee xxxx
Posts.Title: 2nd chemo tomorrow

Posts.Content: morning everyone ,just having a break and a cuppa from blitzing the house ready for my second chemo tomorrow,bloods done yesterday ,got emend to take an hour before chemo tomorrow and another couple of them for Thursday and Friday so along with all the other anti sickness tablets I shouldn.t have the sickness like last time.i am feeling really ok so hope this continues the only thing have had is couple of mouth ulcers but got some gel from nurse for that and they are nearly gone.been having a bit of a competition with my black lab (William) who can shed the most hair. so took control and had mine shaved off feels really liberating,given my scalp a really good moisturize and wearing my pretty scarves and when I went out in my wig no one even noticed it wasn.t mine and commented that I was doing well not loosing my hair yet. so tomorrow will see two down four to go,meals prepared for tomorrow and a few essentials in my mary poppins bag to take with me,my other half is doing shopping at morrisons with a list for fresh fruit etc for my juices and strict instructions to bring a nice cream cake back with him. lots of hugs to everyone having there chemo tomorrow we are another day closer to getting better love dee xxxx
Posts.Title: 2nd chemo tomorrow

Posts.Content: hi bunty ann well they say the contents of a womans bag are like the contents of her mind,i think I was a boy scout previously cos I got everything from a toothpick to paracetamols...I take barley sugars,mints,water, a book or magazine,lipbalm,wipes,tissues,anti bac,a little notebook,pen sometimes someone gives you a little tip and I have to write them down cos I forget,and I will take one of my turbans in case I get to hot in my wig. I call my wigs tootsie and Tallulah also I have just ordered a fringe and sideboards attached to a headband to wear under my straw sun hat or my cap. hi callie thanks I hope I don't get any sickness this time. love and hugs everyone deexxxxxxxxxx
Posts.Title: 2nd chemo tomorrow

Posts.Content: Hi Bailybelle I bought a lovely post surgery bra from Matalan of all places sadly they only come in black and white but are pretty lace ones and are lighly padded,they have a little lace insert which is attached with tiny little buttons so you can take it out,they start at a 32A upto a 40DD,i am a 36DD now since chemo weight took hold so my remaining booby is as you would say heavy,but I find this bra really comfy in fact it feels better than the one which I got aeomina as that one when I,ve worn it hurts my ribs around my mastectomy site(had op in oct) and my prosthesis fits well, and for £8 yes £8 its a bargain. Hope this helps Dee xx
Posts.Title: Mastectomy Bras!
